properties.note: Major Irish rivers as simplified LineStrings. Coordinates are [longitude, latitude]. Used to derive province-to-province river connections for the game's proximity/distance system. Sources: OSi/OSNI public-domain river network data, simplified to game resolution (~0.3deg/hex).

properties.name: River Shannon
properties.note: Longest river in Ireland and Britain. Source at Lough Allen (Leitrim), flows south through Lough Ree and Lough Derg to Limerick and the Atlantic estuary.

properties.name: River Liffey
properties.note: Flows east through County Kildare and Dublin, empties into Dublin Bay. Key trade artery for Dublin port.

properties.name: River Lee
properties.note: Flows east through County Cork, empties at Cork Harbour. Navigable to Cork city.

properties.name: River Barrow
properties.note: One of the Three Sisters. Flows south from the Slieve Bloom mountains through Laois, Carlow and Kilkenny to Waterford estuary.

properties.name: River Nore
properties.note: One of the Three Sisters. Flows south through Kilkenny, joins the Barrow near New Ross.

properties.name: River Suir
properties.note: One of the Three Sisters. Flows east through Tipperary and south to Waterford. Navigable to Clonmel.

properties.name: River Blackwater
properties.note: Munster Blackwater. Flows east through Counties Kerry and Cork, then south to Youghal Bay. Sometimes called the Irish Rhine.

properties.name: River Erne
properties.note: Flows north-west from County Cavan through Loughs Oughter, Erne and into Donegal Bay. Important Ulster waterway.

properties.name: River Bann
properties.note: Upper and Lower Bann. Flows north from Mourne mountains through Lough Neagh to the north coast. Principal river of Ulster.
